sentence: Outright winner Patrick Cantlay (11/1): Full disclosure: I was all prepared to list Matt Fitzpatrick as my favorite outright this week until I saw his odds (33/1) — and I wasn’t prepared for him to have a shorter number than the likes of Jordan Spieth and Sam Burns (both 40/1).
author: Jason Sobel
title: Genesis Open perfect spot for Patrick Cantlay to win again

sentence: +3 View gallery Matt Fitzpatrick was shaken after a phone call with his ex-girlfriend who was born in Ukraine +3 View gallery He no longer wants to be so hard on himself as he looks to shine at this year's majors ‘I’d already decided to be a little easier on myself this year and appreciate all that I have but that phone call just emphasised I don’t want to be miserable for the rest of my life worrying about winning golf tournaments.
title: Matt Fitzpatrick left shaken after a call with his ex-girlfriend who was born in Ukraine

author: Rob Goldberg
title: Valspar Championship 2022: Sam Burns Edges Davis Riley After 2-Hole Playoff

sentence: +4 View gallery Englishman Ian Poulter (above) has work to do if he is to make it to this year’s Masters With only one player from each group progressing to the weekend knockout stages, Poulter has to get past American Scottie Scheffler, twice a winner this year, and two of his Ryder Cup comrades in Tommy Fleetwood and Matt Fitzpatrick.
author: Derek Lawrenson for the Daily Mail
title: Ian Poulter is praying for one more match play miracle to qualify for his 17th Masters next month... with the Englishman needing to jump 17 places in the world rankings into the top 50

sentence: +3 View gallery Ian Poulter needed a huge week but suffered a comprehensive defeat by Matt Fitzpatrick +3 View gallery Fitzpatrick's game is well suited to the Match Play format and he played superbly Having lost on the opening day to American Scottie Scheffler, it means the only way Poulter can now make it to Augusta is by winning the Valero Texas Open next week.
author: Derek Lawrenson for the Daily Mail
title: Could Tiger Woods pull off a miracle and still play at the Masters? American great's name remains listed on the tournament website with less than two weeks until the tournament starts

sentence: Being two down with two to go and knowing all I needed was a half to move on to the round of 16, that’s a real confidence boost to birdie the last two to get through.” Horschel will face either Matt Fitzpatrick or Scottie Scheffler in the knockout stages after Scheffler’s 5 and 4 victory over Fitzpatrick left the pair tied on two points at the top of group five.
author: Phil Casey
title: Billy Horschel into Match Play last 16 after dramatic draw with Thomas Pieters

sentence: Matthew Fitzpatrick (+5500, $7,700): The Englishman has top 10 finishes in four of his last five stroke-play events, with his one recent weakness — his irons — suddenly firing again.
title: Sleeper picks who could make noise at the Masters (no, not Tiger)

sentence: +3 View gallery Matthew Fitzpatrick (above) was one under through six and Lee Westwood had fallen back to level par through 13 Tommy Fleetwood carded a disappointing 75 after a triple bogey on the 11th.
title: Masters: 2016 champion Danny Willet leads the British charge at Augusta

sentence: +4 View gallery Englishman Matt Fitzpatrick started his second round slowly with a three-putt at the first McIlroy believes he is firmly in contention following a battling second round.
author: Derek Lawrenson for the Daily Mail
title: DEREK LAWRENSON: Rory McIlroy's hopes of a career Grand Slam recede into the distance for another year as the Northern Irishman's misery is compounded by 2011 champion Charl Schwartzel's early charge

Spaun, Min Woo Lee 12:40 p.m. — Harry Higgs, Lee Westwood 12:50 p.m. — Si Woo Kim, Hudson Swafford 1 p.m. — Marc Leishman, Talor Gooch 1:10 p.m. — Hideki Matsuyama, Viktor Hovland 1:30 p.m. — Webb Simpson, Will Zalatoris 1:40 p.m. — Dustin Johnson, Cameron Champ 1:50 p.m. — Rory McIlroy, Collin Morikawa 2 p.m. — Tommy Fleetwood, Jason Kokrak 2:10 p.m. — Corey Conners, Danny Willett 2:20 p.m. — Charl Schwartzel, Justin Thomas 2:30 p.m. — Sungjae Im, Shane Lowry 2:40 p.m. — Scottie Scheffler, Cameron Smith SHARE: Anyone can read Conversations, but to contribute, you should be registered Torstar account holder.
author: The Associated Press
title: Masters Tee Times

sentence: AUGUSTA, Ga. (AP) — A look at the key hole Sunday in the final round of the Masters: HOLE: 12 YARDAGE: 155 PAR: 3 STROKE AVERAGE: 3.35 RANK: 2 KEY FACT: It surrendered only two birdies to 52 players — Matthew Fitzpatrick and 2021 Masters champion Hideki Matsuyama had the 2s — on Sunday, and it was where Cameron Smith’s chances at the green jacket came to an end.
author: The Associated Press
title: Key hole on Sunday at the Masters

sentence: He closed on one over with a 73 for a tie of 12th, while Lee Westwood and Matt Fitzpatrick climbed to two over with respective sub-par rounds of one and two under.
author: Riath Al-Samarrai for the Daily Mail
title: Tyrrell Hatton admits 'I'm just glad it's all over' as the English hothead can't hide his anger after finishing SEVENTEEN over par at the Masters
